plan: In the first few rounds, I'll test a balanced strategy by bidding slightly below my value to gauge others' aggressiveness. I'll vary bids between conservative (10-20% below value) and aggressive (matching or slightly above value) to see patterns in Betty's and Charles's bids. Mid-game, I'll experiment with aggressive bids when my value is high to capitalize on potential profits. In later rounds, I'll refine my approach based on observed patterns, focusing on maximizing profit by slightly undercutting opponents' likely bids, especially when my value is near the upper range. This adaptive strategy aims for long-term profit maximization.

In the initial rounds, I'll test a moderate bidding strategy by setting my sealed bid slightly above my value to gather data on opponents' behavior. I'll adjust based on patterns, such as if they often bid close to their value or more aggressively. Midway, I'll test an aggressive strategy by placing bids significantly above my value to secure wins and observe opponent reactions. In later rounds, I'll refine my approach by balancing risk and reward, bidding closer to my value when opponents appear cautious, and more aggressively when they seem risk-averse. This adaptive strategy aims to maximize long-term profit.

In the initial rounds, I'll test aggressive bidding by setting bids close to my value to gather data on competitors' strategies. I'll adjust based on observed patterns, experimenting with conservative bids when my value is low and aggressive bids when it's high. I'll also test mid-range bids to balance risk and reward. Over time, I'll refine my approach by analyzing the outcomes of different strategies, focusing on maximizing long-term profit. I'll remain flexible, ready to pivot strategies based on competitors' behaviors, ensuring adaptability to varying auction dynamics.
